title: Art of the Islamic world : a resource for educators / edited by Maryam D. Ekhtiar and Claire Moore

name.label: Author
name.content: Metropolitan Museum of Art (New York, N.Y.)

name.label: Subject
name.content: Metropolitan Museum of Art (New York, N.Y.) Department of Islamic Art

notes.label: Notes
notes.content: Family guide, Dazzling details in folded front cover.

notes.label: Notes
notes.content: Posters and CD-ROM in pocket of back cover.

notes.label: Notes
notes.content: Issued in slipcase.

notes.label: Notes
notes.content: CD-ROM includes a PDF of the teacher resource guide, digital images of 45 featured works of art in the Metropolitan Museum's collection of easy viewing for the classroom, digital images of related objects to support classroom activities, and maps.

notes.label: Contents
notes.content: Islam and religious art -- Arabic script and the art of calligraphy -- Geometric design in Islamic art -- Science and the art of the Islamic world -- Courtly splendor in the Islamic world -- The making of a Persian royal manuscript : the Shahnama (Book of Kings) of Shah Tahmasp -- From the city to the steppe : art beyond the royal court -- Trade and artistic exchange

physicalDescription.label: Physical description
physicalDescription.content: 236 p. : col. ill., col. maps ; 31 cm + 1 family guide (1 folded sheet [6 p.] : col. ill. ; 28 cm) + 1 CD-ROM + 2 posters (76 x 46 cm folded to 24 x 19 cm)
